alert.note: Alert for Kaibab Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 12:19PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 100 PM MST... At 1217 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Warm Springs Canyon, or 21 miles southeast of Kanab, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warm Springs Canyon, Le Fevre Overlook, Moquitch Canyon, and Mangum Canyon, Mangum Fire scar, and Highway 89A between Jacob Lake and Fredonia. This includes U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 583 and 597. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding and debris flows. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways and be aware of hydroplaning danger.
